conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and how it will be directed into the containers.
The baffles are labeled A, B, C, and D. The containers are labeled E, F, and G.
Liquid from baffle A will be directed towards container E.
Liquid from baffle B will be directed towards container F.
Liquid from baffle C will be directed towards container G.
Liquid from baffle D will be directed towards container G.
Container E receives liquid from baffle A.
Container F receives liquid from baffle B.
Container G receives liquid from baffles C and D.
Image 1 shows the initial setup with the baffles and containers.
Image 2 shows the liquid flowing through the baffles.
Image 3 shows the final distribution of the liquid in the containers.
Liquid from A will flow into container E.
Liquid from B will flow into container F.
Liquid from C will flow into container G.
Liquid from D will flow into container G.
